definition: favoritism shown to sb because of the influence of the person's wife or other female relative/(by extension) favoritism towards relatives, friends or associates
skirt/CL:條|条[tiao2]
old variant of 裙[qun2]
old variant of 裙[qun2]
band/belt/girdle/ribbon/tire/area/zone/region/CL:條|条[tiao2]/to wear/to carry/to take along/to bear (i.e. to have)/to lead/to bring/to look after/to raise
mountain pass/to close/to shut/to turn off/to concern/to involve
surname Guan
to tie/to fasten/to button up
to connect/to arrest/to worry
to connect/to relate to/to tie up/to bind/to be (literary)
system/department/faculty

sentences.english: Cage changed his name to deflect accusations of nepotism.
sentences.chinese: 凯奇改了名字以避免别人指责他搞裙带关系。

sentences.english: It's hard to avoid suspicions of nepotism about the program's management team.
sentences.chinese: 很难让人不去怀疑这个项目的运作中存在裙带关系。
新教徒之间的裙带关系是与生俱来的。

sentences.english: The mayor leaned over backward to avoid the appearance of nepotism.
sentences.chinese: 市长为了避免裙带关系的出现而走向了另一个极端。

sentences.english: That looked like just the sort of nepotism that the president abhors.
sentences.chinese: 而这正是总统深恶痛绝的裙带关系。

sentences.english: The congressman lashed the president for his nepotism.
sentences.chinese: 国会议员抨击总统搞裙带关系。

sentences.english: After all, rewarding people according to merit is superior to corruption or nepotism.
sentences.chinese: 毕竟，基于业绩给与奖励要优于腐败和裙带关系。

sentences.english: In Central Asia the most successful companies are sinecures of nepotism.
sentences.chinese: 而在中亚，最成功的公司往往是靠裙带关系。

sentences.english: The corruption, nepotism, favoritism, moneyembezzlement, all and all will fall apart.
sentences.chinese: 腐败，裙带关系，徇私枉法以及贪污都将土崩瓦解。

definition: to appoint people by favoritism (idiom); nepotism/corrupt appointment
lit. to enter by the back door/fig. to gain influence by pull or unofficial channels/back door or under the counter connections
to seek contact with sb for one's own benefit/to suck up to sb
to smooth whiskers and pat a horse's bottom (idiom); to use flatter to get what one wants/to toady/boot-licking
to use one's position for personal gain (idiom)
toadying for personal gain/to curry favor/to study in great depth
to cling to the powerful and rich (idiom); social climbing
officials shield one another (idiom); a cover-up
see 走門路|走门路[zou3 men2 lu4]
see 扳龍附鳳|扳龙附凤[ban1 long2 fu4 feng4]
contacts/connections/network
children of officials/word created by analogy with 富二代[fu4 er4 dai4]
seat of honor/person in a high-ranking position/to be promoted to a more senior role/(genetics) epistatic
lit. to hide the sky with one hand/to hide the truth from the masses
to curry favor (idiom); playing up to those in power/social climbing
special relation
